FrequentCategoryImputer¶

class missing_data_imputers.FrequentCategoryImputer(variables=None)[source]¶

Replaces missing data in categorical variables by the most frequent category.

This Imputer works only with categorical variables.

The transformer fills the missing data with the mode.

Parameters:variables (list) – The list of variables to be imputed. If none, it defaults to all object type variables.
imputer_dict_¶

dictionary – The dictionary mapping each variable to the most frequent category which will be used to fill NA. It is calculated when fitting the transformer.

fit(X, y=None)[source]¶

Learns the most frequent category for each variable.

Parameters:
  • X (pandas dataframe of shape = [n_samples, n_features]) – The training input samples.
  • y (None) – y is not needed in this transformer, yet the sklearn pipeline API requires this parameter for checking.
transform(X)[source]¶

Replaces missing data with the calculated parameters

Parameters:X (pandas dataframe of shape = [n_samples, n_features]) – The input samples.
Returns:X_transformed – The dataframe containing no missing values for the selected variables
Return type:dataframe of shape = [n_samples, n_features]
